MINUTES OF Motion Hearing held before Judge Philip S. Gutierrez: The Both Groups Motion to Consoliate actions 11 ; Electrical Workers Pension Fund Local 103, I.b.e.w.s Motion for Consolidation 16 ; The Kabrey Groups Motion to Consolidate Actions 20 ;The Silberman Groups Motion to Consolidate Related Cases 23 ;Powerwave Investors Groups Motion for consolidation of Related Action 26 .The Court hears oral argument on the above-reference motions, and take the motions uner submission. The court is informed of defendants intention to submit a motion to dismiss as a repsonse pleading upon the filing of lead plaintiffs consolidated complaint. Court Reporter: Lisa Gonzalez.(pcl) (Entered: 06/04/2007)
NOTICE of Authorities filed by plaintiffs Jerry Michael Crafton, Farokh Etemadieh, John Both. (bg) (Entered: 06/26/2007)

MINUTES (IN CHAMBERS) by Judge Philip S. Gutierrez: Boths Motion for Appointment as Lead Plaintiff and for Consolidation 11 ; Silbermann Groups Motion for Appointment as Lead Plaintiff and for Consolidation 23 ; Kabrey Groups Motion for Appointment as Lead Plaintiff and for Consolidation 20 ; Electrical Workers Pension Funds Motion for Appointment as Lead Plaintiff and for Consolidation 16 . The Court orders consolidation of the related cases SACV07-65, CV07-839, SACV 07-158 and SACV 07-287. The Court also appoints Mr Both as lead plaintiff and his attorneys from the firms Weiss & Lurie and the Brualdi Law Firm as co-lead counsel. Therefore, the Court GRANTS Boths Motion for Consolidation and for Appointment as Lead Plaintiff. The Court DENIES (1) the Silbermann Groups Motion for Appointment as Lead Plaintiff, (2) the EWPFs Motion for Appointment as Lead Plaintiff, and (3) the Kabrey Groups Motion for Appointment as Lead Plaintiff. The files of the consolidated cases will be maintained under the master file number SACV07-65 PSG (MLGx). This consolidation is for all purposes, including discovery, pretrial and trial proceedings. Unless the parties otherwise agree, lead plaintiff shall file an amended and consolidated class action complaint on or before 60 days from the date of entry of this Order. Defendants shall file a responsive pleading on or before 60 days from the date the amended consolidated class action complaint is filed. (See document for further details.) (pcl) (Entered: 06/15/2007)

MINUTES IN CHAMBERS ORDER on Defendants' Motion to Dismiss 71 held before Judge Philip S. Gutierrez: Before this Court is Defendants Motion to Dismiss. The Court heard oral argument on this motion on April 14, 2008. The Court GRANTS-IN-PART Defendants Motion to Dismiss. Specifically, the Court finds that Plaintiffs securities fraud claim based on Defendants revenue projections in 2006 is barred because the projections are protected forward-looking statements under the PSLRA. Furthermore, the Court finds that Plaintiffs first claim against defendants Michaels, Buschur, and Edwards for violations of ยง 10(b) of the Exchange Act and SEC rule 10b-5 is insufficiently pled with particularity. Thus, the Court dismisses this claim against theindividual defendants, with leave to amend. If the Plaintiffs are able to plead claims against the individual defendants with the required particularity, they may filed a Second Amended Consolidated Complaint within ten days of the date of entry of this Order. However, the Court finds that Plaintiffs have adequately alleged a securities fraud claim against the corporate defendant based on Powerwaves 2005 financial reports. As a result, Plaintiffs second claim against the individual defendants for violations of ยง 20(a) survives.IT IS SO ORDERED. (es) (Entered: 04/21/2008)

ORDER by Judge Philip S. Gutierrez: granting 157 REIMBURSEMENT OF ATTORNEYS' FEES AND EXPENSES: NOTE CHANGES MADE BY THE COURT: IT IS HEREBY ORDERED, ADJUDGED AND DECREED, that: The Court hereby awards Plaintiffs' Co-Lead Counsel attorneys' fees of 33-1/3% of the Settlement Fund, or $1,050,000, and reimbursement of litigation expenses in the amount of $275,418.49, together with the interest earned thereon for the same time period and at the same rate as that earned on the Settlement Fund until paid. The awarded attorneys' fees and expenses and interest earned thereon, shall be paid to Plaintiffs' Co- Lead Counsel within three (3) business days after the date this Order is signed subject to the terms, conditions and obligations of the Stipulation which terms, conditions and obligations are incorporated herein. Lead Plaintiff and Settlement Class Representative John Both, in reimbursement for his time and expenses in aiding the prosecution of this case, shall also be awarded, out of the Settlement Fund $15,000.
